Entries.default: "Sing us another about the shores of Rauatai!"
"Sing us anything but 'The Nāga's Nethers,' won't you?"
"Whose guts twist around like a rusty corkscrew? Oh, the sailor who can't hold down koīki stew..."
"Defiance Bay, am I right?" The sizable aumaua smiles and claps you on the shoulder - hard.
"What can I do for you?"
"What are you doing?"
"Farewell."
"We've got you now!"
"Get that little hairball!"
"Go get them!"

"I was but a face in the crowd, but I remember the one who walked out of Hadret House alive." 

He claps you on the shoulder again - harder - and this time you recognize inebriation behind his enthusiasm.
"He's had more than a few. Perhaps we should go before this ends in rambling professions of love." He leans close to you, speaking low.
"To the motherland!" The sailor tosses back a tankard and wipes his mouth with the back of his sleeve.
"So what brings you here, friend?"
"There's a musician playing his lute by the bridge. Best songs in the district."
"Be seeing you, Watcher."
"This one can strum a lute!"
"Hey, I'm walking here."
"I'm gonna need you and your friends to clear out."

"I... do not understand. We have done nothing wrong." 

The sailor looks from his fellows back to you with a mixture of hurt and confusion.
"Captain gave us extra coin to occupy ourselves while we're on leave."
"Martino Valera wants you out of Queen's Berth."
"Valera. One of the stuck-up pirate hunters?"
"On second thought, you can go about your business."
"Anything I can say or do to convince you to leave?"
"Look, if you just beat it for a few hours, then we both win."
"I'll dump you in the canal, if that's what it takes."

"The canal, huh? Bears consideration."

The sailor looks to his companions with a deadpan expression.

"Always wanted to learn if orlans could float." 

He signals the others to attack.
"Can you play any Rauataian songs?"
"If this Vailian can't carry a tune, I'll cut off his thumbs."
"It's nothing personal - there's just an angry ghost right where you're standing, and I mean to banish it."

"Bah! Joking! There's no... I... No, really?" 

The sailor swallows and glances over his shoulder.
[Raise your hands.] "Begone! I'll have no mischief from you, crooked thing!"
[Stare into space with your mouth hanging open.]
The sailor smirks at his companions. Each in turn shrugs and smiles back to him.
"No. Tell the Valeras they can lick my boots."
At first the sailor looks like he's going to fire back with harsh language, but his expression softens.
"Wonder if he plays any Rauatai songs. Come on, boys. Let's get out of here." He gestures with a jerk of his head.
"We'll make ourselves scarce while you buddy up to the Valeras. Whatever you've got planned, good luck with it."
"We'll leave when we're good and ready. Valera should get used to waiting."
"That's what I thought. Now, if you don't mind..." He nods and turns away.
[Attack] "Time to stamp out a sea rat."

"Sea rats are born survivors!"

The sailor motions for his companions to rally around him.

"I must be seeing double, elf man, because it's like there's a great big... lady crouching on your shoulders."

The sailor squints at Aloth and shrugs.

"We've been draining Vailian wine cellars and trying to remember the words of Rauatai anthems. Loudly, as often as not!"

He turns to his compatriots with unrestrained glee.
The sailors flinch and duck as the power of suggestion and a passing breeze convince them that they are assaulted by angry spirits.

"Back to the ship! We should never have come."

The sailors flee, stumbling on their feet in haste.
Maybe it's just your imagination, but you hear the rustling of cloth and what sounds like a slow, exhaling breath move past your ear.
[Point your finger to a spot in the air and scream.]
The sailor plugs his ears and turns from you to the invisible presence, his eyes widening to the size of saucers.
[Touch his shoulder while he's distracted.]
He flinches as a chill works up his spine, and glances back at you with horror evident in his rigid expression.

"We move for no one. Friend." 

His expression darkens and his hands drop to his sides.

"I'd like to see what happens to one of you things when you stop breathing."

He signals for the others to attack.

"You'll be lucky if someone ever finds what's left of you down there." 

He signals for the others to attack.

"Not worth it. Let's go, mates."

He whistles and gives the signal for the others to depart.
"We haven't imbibed anything we can't regurgitate later!" The sailor shakes his gut at Aloth and laughs.
"Who are you again?"
[Lie] "Of course! How could I forget?"
[Say nothing.]
He gives you a look that is skeptical, if amused.
"You come by for a drink, or just to chat?" The sailor gives you a welcoming grin.
"That's where you're wrong, soldier." Maia whistles through her teeth. Ishiza's feathers bristle at attention.
"To Tākowa. May our enemies crumple under cannon shot." Maia winks at the sailors and raises a fist.
"Meaning no disrespect. This is our shore leave..." He blinks and eases back from her.
"Take it away, Maia."
"Am I hearing things, or is this sailor asking to lose his lower jaw?" Maia pulls up her sleeve and stares down the group.
"Take your pick, Ishiza. The big one is mine."
The bird narrows his eyes and lets out a piercing squawk.

"Maia Rua?" The sailor's eyes bulge. He prods his cohorts with an elbow and a shush.

They all stand at attention.
"Didn't think I'd find you in Queen's Berth, did you? At ease, soldier." Maia clasps her hands and squares her stance.

"Apologies, ma'am. We promise to behave this time."

Swallowing, he looks over to you and nods.
"Off you go." Maia winks down at Ishiza.
Aloth presses his lips together and, for a few seconds, looks as if he's struggling against Iselmyr.
"Also something I'd like to avoid."
